'Sterilization' (also spelled 'sterilisation') refers to any of a number of
medical techniques that intentionally leave a person unable to reproduce. It is
a method of birth control. For other causes of sterility, see infertility.

Sterilization methods include both surgical and non-surgical, and exist for both
males and females. Sterilization procedures are intended to be permanent;
reversal is generally difficult or impossible.
